org.odk.collect.android.geo

Interface MapFragment

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GoogleMapFragment, MapboxMapFragment, OsmDroidMapFragment

    public interface MapFragment
    Interface for a Fragment that renders a map view. The plan is to have one implementation for each map SDK, e.g. GoogleMapFragment, OsmDroidMapFragment, etc. This is intended to be a single map API that provides all functionality needed for the three geo widgets (collecting or editing a point, a trace, or a shape): - Basic control of the viewport (panning, zooming) - Displaying and getting the current GPS location - Requesting a callback on the first GPS location fix - Requesting callbacks for short clicks and long presses on the map - Adding editable points to the map - Adding editable traces (polylines) to the map - Adding editable shapes (closed polygons) to the map Editable points, traces, and shapes are called "map features" in this API. To keep the API small, features are not exposed as objects; instead, they are identified by integer feature IDs. To keep the API unified (instead of having three distinct modes), the map always supports all three kinds of features, even though the geo widgets only use one kind of feature at a time.

    • Method Detail

      • applyConfig

        void applyConfig(android.os.Bundle config)
        Configures the map according to settings such as styling preferences and layer data sources. For now, this means anything that is configurable in the Maps preferences; the intention is to anticipate the possibility of a map configuration delivered with a form. MapFragment implementations do not interact directly with the preferences; instead, they receive a config bundle, which may be derived from the preferences or another source.

      • addTo

        void addTo(@NonNull
           androidx.fragment.app.FragmentActivity activity,
           int containerId,
           @Nullable
           MapFragment.ReadyListener readyListener,
           @Nullable
           MapFragment.ErrorListener errorListener)
        Adds the map Fragment to an activity. The containerId should be the resource ID of a View, into which the map view will be placed. The readyListener will be invoked on the UI thread with this MapFragment when the map is ready, or the errorListener will be invoked if there is a problem initializing the map.

      • getCenter

        @NonNull
MapPoint getCenter()
        Gets the point currently shown at the center of the map view.

      • getZoom

        double getZoom()
        Gets the current zoom level. For maps that only support zooming by powers of 2, the zoom level will always be an integer.

      • setCenter

        void setCenter(@Nullable
               MapPoint center,
               boolean animate)
        Centers the map view on the given point, leaving zoom level unchanged, possibly with animation.

      • zoomToPoint

        void zoomToPoint(@Nullable
                 MapPoint center,
                 boolean animate)
        Centers the map view on the given point, zooming in to a close-up level deemed appropriate by the implementation, possibly with animation.

      • zoomToPoint

        void zoomToPoint(@Nullable
                 MapPoint center,
                 double zoom,
                 boolean animate)
        Centers the map view on the given point with a zoom level as close as possible to the given zoom level, possibly with animation.

      • zoomToBoundingBox

        void zoomToBoundingBox(java.lang.Iterable<MapPoint> points,
                       double scaleFactor,
                       boolean animate)
        Adjusts the map's viewport to enclose all of the given points, possibly with animation. A scaleFactor of 1.0 ensures that all the points will be just visible in the viewport; a scaleFactor less than 1 shrinks the view beyond that. For example, a scaleFactor of 0.8 causes the bounding box to occupy at most 80% of the width and 80% of the height of the viewport, ensuring a margin of at least 10% on all sides.

      • addMarker

        int addMarker(MapPoint point,
              boolean draggable,
              java.lang.String iconAnchor)
        Adds a marker to the map at the given location. If draggable is true, the user will be able to drag the marker to change its location. By default, the marker icon will be R.drawable.ic_map_point. Returns a positive integer, the featureId for the newly added shape.

      • setMarkerIcon

        void setMarkerIcon(int featureId,
                   int drawableId)
        Sets the icon for a marker.

      • getMarkerPoint

        MapPoint getMarkerPoint(int featureId)
        Gets the location of an existing marker.

      • addDraggablePoly

        int addDraggablePoly(@NonNull
                     java.lang.Iterable<MapPoint> points,
                     boolean closedPolygon)
        Adds a polyline or polygon to the map with the given sequence of vertices. The vertices will have handles that can be dragged by the user. Returns a positive integer, the featureId for the newly added shape.

      • appendPointToPoly

        void appendPointToPoly(int featureId,
                       @NonNull
                       MapPoint point)
        Appends a vertex to the polyline or polygon specified by featureId.

      • removePolyLastPoint

        void removePolyLastPoint(int featureId)
        Removes the last vertex of the polyline or polygon specified by featureId. If there are no vertices, does nothing.

      • getPolyPoints

        @NonNull
java.util.List<MapPoint> getPolyPoints(int featureId)
        Returns the vertices of the polyline or polygon specified by featureId, or an empty list if the featureId does not identify an existing polyline or polygon.

      • removeFeature

        void removeFeature(int featureId)
        Removes a specified map feature from the map, leaving its featureId invalid.

      • clearFeatures

        void clearFeatures()
        Removes all map features from the map.

      • setClickListener

        void setClickListener(@Nullable
                      MapFragment.PointListener listener)
        Sets or clears the callback for a click on the map.

      • setLongPressListener

        void setLongPressListener(@Nullable
                          MapFragment.PointListener listener)
        Sets or clears the callback for a long press on the map.

      • setFeatureClickListener

        void setFeatureClickListener(@Nullable
                             MapFragment.FeatureListener listener)
        Sets or clears the callback for a click on a feature.

      • setDragEndListener

        void setDragEndListener(@Nullable
                        MapFragment.FeatureListener listener)
        Sets or clears the callback for when a drag is completed.

      • setGpsLocationEnabled

        void setGpsLocationEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Enables/disables GPS tracking. While enabled, the GPS location is shown on the map, the first GPS fix will trigger any pending callbacks set by runOnGpsLocationReady(), and every GPS fix will invoke the callback set by setGpsLocationListener().

      • getGpsLocation

        @Nullable
MapPoint getGpsLocation()
        Gets the last GPS location fix, or null if there hasn't been one.

      • getLocationProvider

        @Nullable
java.lang.String getLocationProvider()
        Gets the provider of the last fix, or null if there hasn't been one.

      • runOnGpsLocationReady

        void runOnGpsLocationReady(@NonNull
                           MapFragment.ReadyListener listener)
        Queues a callback to be invoked on the UI thread as soon as a GPS fix is available. If there already is a location fix, the callback is invoked immediately; otherwise, when a fix is obtained, it will be invoked once. To begin searching for a GPS fix, call setGpsLocationEnabled(true). Activities that set callbacks should call setGpsLocationEnabled(false) in their onStop() or onDestroy() methods, to prevent invalid callbacks.

      • setGpsLocationListener

        void setGpsLocationListener(@Nullable
                            MapFragment.PointListener listener)
        Sets or clears the callback for GPS location updates. This callback will only be invoked while GPS is enabled with setGpsLocationEnabled().
